card.name: Dunlending Rampager
card.property: When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 2 cards from hand to discard him.
To kill and destroy was the mission of the wild hillmen.

card.name: Dunlending Renegade
card.property: When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 2 cards from hand to discard him.
The strength of the hillmen was driven by passion and anger.

card.name: Leaping Blaze
card.property: Shadow: Spot 3 [Dunland] minions to shuffle your hand into your draw deck and draw 8 cards. The Free Peoples player may discard 3 cards from hand to prevent this.
”…they saw torches, countless points of fiery light upon the black fields behind, scattered like red flowers, or winding up from the lowlands….”

card.name: Wild Men of the Hills
card.property: The twilight cost of this minion is -2 during the skirmish phase. When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 4 cards from hand to discard it.
The swarm of Dunlendings destroyed everything in its path.

card.name: Baruk Khazad
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound a minion. You may take the next maneuver action.
”…a small dark figure that none had observed sprang out of the shadows and gave a hoarse shout….”

card.name: Defending the Keep
card.property: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf to Draw a card or play a [Dwarven] condition from your discard pile.
”'I have fought many wars, master Dwarf. I know how to defend my own Keep.'”

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound a minion assigned to skirmish an unbound companion.
preparations, Gimli found it necessary to warn him of the advancing Uruk army.

card.name: Horn of Helm
card.property: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf companion to make each minion at a battleground lose all damage bonuses until the regroup phase.
”…sudden and terrible, from the tower above, the sound of the great horn of Helm rang out.”

card.name: More to My Liking
card.property: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Stack the top card from your draw deck here (limit once per phase). Maneuver: Spot a Dwarf and discard a card stacked on a [Dwarven] condition to take a Free Peoples card stacked here into hand.
”'This country has tough bones.'”

card.name: Balglin
card.property: To play, spot an Elf. While skirmishing a wounded minion, Balglin takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase.
He is a strong fighter. He asks for no quarter and gives none.

card.name: Break the Charge
card.property: Archery: Exert 3 Elf companions to make the fellowship archery total +2.
A storm of white arrows answered the attacking hand of Isengard.

card.name: Legolas
card.property: Bearer must be Legolas. Each time the fellowship moves, you may spot a wounded minion to heal Legolas.
Legolas wielded a longsword to strike from horseback.

card.name: Taurnil
card.property: To play, spot an Elf. While Taurnil bears a ranged weapon, the twilight cost of each Shadow possession is +2, and he does not add to the fellowship archery total.
Taurnil's careful aim can disarm his enemies at long range.

card.name: That Is No Orc Horn
card.property: Regroup: Spot 3 Elf companions to heal a companion and liberate a site.
Anxious defenders cheered the welcome sound of Elvish trumpets.

card.name: Birchseed
card.property: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow Birchseed to skirmish. Fellowship: Exert Birchseed to Heal an unbound Hobbit.
Slender and royal, he presided over many Entmoots.

card.name: Down From the Hills
card.property: Spell. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf 3 times to make an unbound companion with the Gandalf signet strength +5, defender +1, damage +2, and unable to take wounds until the regroup phase.
“Down leaped Shadowfax, like a deer….”

card.name: Forest Guardian
card.property: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow this companion to skirmish.
”'We keep off strangers and the foolhardy; and we train and we teach, we walk and we weed.'”

card.name: Fury of the White Rider
card.property: Spell. Maneuver: Spot 3 twilight tokens and exert Gandalf to wound a minion twice.
”The White Rider was upon them, and the terror of his coming filled the enemy with madness.”

card.name: Lindenroot
card.property: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow Lidenroot to skirmish. Skirmish: Exert Lidenroot to wound an [Isengard] minion he is skirmishing.
A most well-founded and considerate Ent.

card.name: Turn of the Tide
card.property: Spell. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf to discard up to 2 shadow possessions. Any Shadow player may discard a minion to prevent this.
”'Indeed my friends, none of you have any weapon that could hurt me.'”

card.name: Be Back Soon
card.property: Maneuver: Discard Smeagol to discard a minion. An opponent may exert a minion twice to prevent this.
”'Now I wonder where he's got to?'”

card.name: Evil-smelling Fens
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each site on the adventure path is a marsh. Shadow: Exert Gollum twice and discard this condition to play a minion from your discard pile.
”'No birds here. There are snakeses, wormses, things in the pools. Lots of things, lots of nasty things.'”

card.name: Follow Smeagol
card.property: Plays on Smeagol. Regroup: Exert Smeagol or Gollum to play the fellowship's next site ( replacing opponent's site if necessary ).

card.name: Gollum
card.property: Regroup: Discard Gollum to exert a companion or ally.
”'…we won't let you go, either. You're full of wickedness and mischief, Gollum.'”

card.name: Gollum
card.property: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each times Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.
”'Still he's a Baggins, my precious, yes, a Baggins. A Baggins stole it. He found it and he said nothing. We hates Bagginses.'”

card.name: Gollum
card.property: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each time Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.
”'Still he's a Baggins, my precious, yes, a Baggins. A Baggins stole it. He found it and he said nothing. We hates Bagginses.'”

card.name: Look at Him
card.property: Shadow: Spot Smeagol or Gollum to add (1) for each burden.
”'That's what it is. It's that Gollum! Snakes and adders! And to think I thought that we'd puzzle him with our bit of a climb!'”

card.name: Poor Wretch
card.property: Plays on Smeagol. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make Smeagol damage +1.
”'Throttle us in our sleep, that's his plan.'”

card.name: Smeagol
card.property: Ring-bound. To play add a burden. Regroup: Exert Smeagol (or Gollum) twice to reveal the top 4 cards of your draw deck. Wound a minion for each Shadow card revealed. Place those 4 cards beneath your draw deck in any order.
”'Could you find anything fit for a hungry hobbit?'”

card.name: Smeagol
card.property: Ring-bound. To play, add a burden. Skirmish: Add a burden to make Smeagol strength +2 and take no wounds.
”'… that it is my fate to receive help from you, where I least looked for it, and your fate to help me whom you long pursued with evil purpose.'”

card.name: Smeagol
card.property: Ring-bound. To play, add a burden. Skirmish: Add a burden to make Smeagol strength +2 and take no wounds.
”'… that it is my fate to receive help from you, where I least looked for it, and your fate to help me whom you long pursued with evil purpose.'”

card.name: We Must Have It
card.property: Shadow: Play Gollum from your draw deck or your discard pile. Skirmish: Discard a card at random from hand to make Gollum strength +3.
”'No, sweet one. See, my precious: if we has it, then we can escape, even from Him, eh?'”

card.name: Alcarin
card.property: Knight. The twilight cost of each other knight in your starting fellowship is -1. Assignment: Assign Alcarin to a minion bearing a [Gondor] fortification to heal Alcarin.
Named for a mighty king, Alcarin is determined to prove himself in battle.

card.name: Citadel of the Stars
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert a [Gondor] Man or spot 3 knights to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [Gondor] Man.
The city of Osgiliath was the first capital of Gondor.

card.name: City Wall
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert a [Gondor] Man or spot 3 knights to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [Gondor] Man.
The war-weary defenses of Osgiliath still protected the Men of Gondor.

card.name: Fall Back
card.property: Skirmish: Discard all Shadow cards borne by a minion bearing a [Gondor] fortification.
Osgiliath's defenses protected the Gondorian troops.

card.name: Gondorian Knight
card.property: Knight.
Soldiers of Gondor share a long heritage of defending their borders against Sauron's attackers.

card.name: Knight of Gondor
card.property: Knight. Fellowship: Discard a [Gondor] condition to heal this companion.
The brave men of Gondor's army were well-armed and armored.

card.name: Men of Numenor
card.property: Skirmish: Wound a minion bearing a [Gondor] fortification.
”'…I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory….'”

card.name: Rally Point
card.property: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a knight to transfer a [Gondor] fortification borne by a minion to your support area.
A strategic fallback helps Gondorian knights to plan their counterattack.

card.name: Stone Tower
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert 2 [Gondor] Men to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [Gondor] Man.
The battlements of Osgiliath provided some defense against Sauron's attackers.

card.name: Take Cover
card.property: Fellowship: Exert a knight to play a [Gondor] fortification from your discard pile.
Gondor forces at Osgiliath were too few to fight the advancing armies in the field.

card.name: These Are My People
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Aragorn twice to play any number of possessions from your discard pile onto companions with the Aragorn signet.
”'…I will die as one of them.'”

card.name: Turgon
card.property: Knight. To play, spot a knight. Maneuver: Exert Turgon to wound a minion bearing a [Gondor] fortification.
He hopes to someday become one of the knights of Dol Amroth.

card.name: War Must Be
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Gondor] Man strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a minion bearing a [Gondor] fortification).
”'…we defend ourselves against a destroyer who would devour all….'”

card.name: Battering Ram
card.property: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai to place an [Isengard] token on this card. Skirmish: Spot 5 companions and an [Isengard] token here to make an Uruk-hai damage +1. Discard this condition.
“The trees… smote the timbers with a rending boom.”

card.name: Berserk Rager
card.property: Damage +1. Berserk Rager is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 3 [Isengard] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Rager twice to wound every ally twice.
Their mission at Helm's Deep was to clear the walls.

card.name: Berserk Savage
card.property: Damage +1. Berserk Savage is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 4 [Isengard] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Savage twice to make it strength +8.
Skull-like helmets are distinctive to the Berserkers.

card.name: Berserk Slayer
card.property: Damage +1. Berserk Slayer is strength +2 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 5 [Isengard] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Slayer twice to wound every companion.
Berserkers are the first wave of Uruks sent to battle.

card.name: Black Shapes Crawling
card.property: Maneuver: Spot X Uruk-hai. The Free Peoples player may assign X wounds to your minions. Play X [Isengard] weapons from your discard pile.
Some were squat and broad, some were tall and grim, with high helms and sable shields.

card.name: Devilry of Orthanc
card.property: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-Hai to place an [Isengard] token on this card. Maneuver: Spot 8 [Isengard] tokens to exert every character. Discard this condition.
”'They have a blasting fire, and… they took the Wall.'”

card.name: Foul Horde
card.property: Warg-rider. While Foul Horde is not exhausted, it is fierce. While Foul Horde has at least 3 vitality, it is ambush (1). While Foul Horde has at least 4 vitality, it is damage + 1.

card.name: Grima
card.property: Maneuver: Spot 4 Free Peoples cultures and exert Grima to return an unbound companion, and all cards on him or her, to their owners' hands.
”'I care for you and yours as best I may…. Let others deal with these irksome guests.'”

card.name: Isengard Flanker
card.property: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.
Sharku used his warg-riders to scout and defend.

card.name: Isengard Rider
card.property: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.
”'He has taken Orcs into his service, and Wolf-riders, and evil Men….'”

card.name: Isengard Scimitar
card.property: Bearer must be an [Isengard] Orc. When you play this weapon, you may add (1) for each site you control.
Orcs from Isengard favor a short, curved sword when mounted.

card.name: Isengard Scout Troop
card.property: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, it is fierce. Each time an [Isengard] Orc wins a skirmish, you may exert this minion to control a site.
”'…where the warg howls, there also the orc prowls.'”

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. Each time the fellowship moves, you may heal each [Isengard] Orc twice. Shadow: Exert Saruman to play an [Isengard] possession from your discard pile.

card.name: Scaling Ladder
card.property: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai to place an [Isengard] token on this card. Skirmish: Spot an [Isengard] token here to heal an Uruk-hai. Discard this condition.
“Hundreds of long ladders were lifted up. Many were cast down in ruin, but many more replaced them….”

card.name: Sharku
card.property: Warg-rider. While Sharku is not exhausted, he is fierce. Each time you play an [Isengard] mount, you may make the Free Peoples player exert a companion (except a Hobbit).
Only Sharku commanded enough respect to control Saruman's warg-riders.

card.name: Sharku
card.property: Bearer must be a warg-rider. If bearer is Sharku, he is damage +1. Response: If a skirmish special ability is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.
The warg-captain picked the fastest and strongest mount.

card.name: Siege Engine
card.property: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Play an Uruk-hai to place an [Isengard] token on a machine. Response: If one or more machines are about to be discarded by an opponent, discard this condition to prevent that.
“Ropes… were hurled over the parapet….”

card.name: Uruk Engineer
card.property: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may place an [Isengard] token on a machine.
Trained Uruk-hai operated Saruman's siege engines at Helm's Deep.

card.name: Uruk Sapper
card.property: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may place an [Isengard] token on a machine.
The destruction of the Hornburg fortifications was the task of Saruman's engineer troops.

card.name: Uruk-hai Berserker
card.property: Damage +1. This minion is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish.
Goatskins full of blood poured upon berserkers before battle instill their bloodlust.

card.name: War-warg
card.property: Bearer must a warg-rider. Response: If a skirmish special abiliy is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.
Bigger and stronger wargs were ridden into battle.

card.name: Warg
card.property: Bearer must a warg-rider. Response: If a skirmish special abiliy is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.
”'Tell him there is no hope ahead. He should return to Edoras before the wolves of Isengard come there.'”

card.name: Warg-master
card.property: Warg-rider. When you play this minion, you may play an [Isengard] mount from your discard pile. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.
”'…yet I feared that wolf-riders and plunderers might ride nonetheless to Meduseld, while it was undefended.'”

card.name: Warg-rider
card.property: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.
“Swiftly a scout rode back and reported that wolf-riders were abroad in the valley….”

card.name: Wolf-voices
card.property: Skirmish: Make an [Isengard] Orc strength +2 (and heal it if mounted).
”'…these howls freeze my blood.'”

card.name: Wolves of Isengard
card.property: Plays on a plains site you control. Regroup: Exert an [Isengard] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.
Saruman's warg-riders traveled the plains faster than even the Riders of Rohan.

card.name: Army of Haradrim
card.property: Southron. Skirmish: Remove (3) to play a [Raider] mount from your discard pile.
The desert lords of Harad support their huge forces with mammoth war beasts.

card.name: Company of Haradrim
card.property: Southron. Regroup: Remove (9) and spot antother Southron to make the move limit -1 for this turn ( to a minimum of 1 ).
The quick movements of Southron soldiers cut off all paths of retreat.

card.name: Desert Stalker
card.property: Southron. Ambush (2). Maneuver: Exert this minion and spot 4 free peoples cultures to exert every companion.
They strike only when their prey is haggard and tired.

card.name: Mumak
card.property: Bearer must be a Southron. Bearer is fierce. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may add (2).
“Sam saw a vast shape crash out of the trees and come careening down the slope.”

card.name: Southron Marcher
card.property: Southron. Ambush (2). While you can spot a Southron, this minion's twilight cost is - 2.
Hardy desert warriors needed little rest.

card.name: Southron Runner
card.property: Southron. Ambush (2). While you can spot a Southron, this minion's twilight cost is - 2.
Swift scouts track enemy movements to set up surprise attacks.

card.name: Southron Traveler
card.property: Southron. Ambush (2). Response: If a Southron is about to take a wound, remove (3) to prevent that wound.
Men of Harad were used to long journeys.

card.name: Strength in Numbers
card.property: To play, spot a Southron. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Discard this condition to add (1) for each Man with ambush you spot.
Lacking arms and armor, the Haradrim use swift movements to outnumber their opponents.

card.name: War Mumak
card.property: Bearer must be a Southron. Bearer is fierce. Each time bearer overwhelms a character, you may add (5).
“Big as a house, much bigger than a house, it looked to him, a grey-clad moving hill.”

card.name: Armory
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 2 [Rohan] Men to remove 2 tokens from a machine or to take a [Rohan] possession into hand from your discard pile. Discard this condition.
”'Choose from these ere we go, and may they serve you well!'”

card.name: Arrow-slits
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 2 [Rohan] Men to discard a possession or a machine. Discard this condition.
“Here and there were clefts in the stone through which men could shoot.”

card.name: Ecglaf
card.property: Villager. Fellowship: Exert Ecglaf and spot 2 valiant Men to play a [Rohan] possession from your discard pile.
Like many of the Rohirrim, Ecglaf no longer had a home awaiting his return.

card.name: Gamling
card.property: Valiant. To play spot a [Rohan] Man. Skirmish: Play a [Rohan] possession on Gamling to make him strength +2 and damage +1.

card.name: Household Guard
card.property: Valiant.
“The king and the men of his household were in the Hornburg….”

card.name: I Am Here
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Theoden twice to heal every other companion with the Theoden signet twice.
”'The last host of the Eorlingas has ridden forth. It will not return without battle.'”

card.name: Let Us Be Swift
card.property: Regroup: Spot 3 valiant Men to discard up to 2 conditions and liberate a site.
”'Let us drive through such foes as are already between us and the fastness.'”

card.name: No Rest for the Weary
card.property: Maneuver: Spot 3 valiant Men to make one of those Men defender +1 until the regroup phase.
”'We must draw all our forces now behind the walls.'”

card.name: Parapet
card.property: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Archery: Spot 2 [Rohan] Men to remove 2 tokens from a machine or to make the minion archery total -3. Discard this condition.
Upon the spur of rock from the cliff stood high walls of ancient stone.

card.name: Rohirrim Bow
card.property: Bearer must be a [Rohan] Man. Archery: Exert bearer and discard this possession to wound a minion.
”'The Rohirrim have good bowmen after their fashion, but there are too few here, too few.'”

card.name: Rohirrim Helm
card.property: Bearer must be [Rohan] Man. Skirmish: Discard this possession to cancel a skirmish involving bearer. A minion in this skirmish may exert to prevent this.
The armory of Helm's Deep provided raiment of war for her defenders.

card.name: Rohirrim Scout
card.property: Valiant. Regroup: Exert this companion and spot a [Rohan] possession to return that possession to hand.
”…scouts rode out far ahead, passing like shadows in the folds of the land.”

card.name: Rohirrim Shield
card.property: Bearer must be a [Rohan] Man. The minion archery total is -1. Regroup: Discard this possession to heal bearer.
The Rohirrim carried round wooden shields, usable on foot and on horseback.

card.name: Sigewulf
card.property: Villager. Regroup: Exert Sigewulf and spot 5 valiant Men to discard a minion.
The courage of Sigewulf and other Rohirrim like him will not be forgotten.

card.name: Theoden
card.property: Valiant. Maneuver: Play a [Rohan] possession on Theoden to heal a [Rohan] ally.
”'You thought I remained in Meduseld bent like an old tree under winter snow…. But a west wind has shaken the boughs.'”

card.name: Thundering Host
card.property: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a mounted [Rohan] Man strength +3 (and heal that Man if at a plains).
”…with a rush like the sudden onset of a great wind the last host of Rohan rode thundering into the West.”

card.name: Dead Marshes
card.property: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 4T, Ring-bound companions skirmishing [Sauron] orcs are strength -1. Maneuver: Spot 2 [Sauron] Orcs to play up to 2 [Sauron] conditions from your discard pile. Discard this condition.

card.name: Eye of Barad-Dur
card.property: Skirmish: Make a companion or ally skirmishing a [Sauron] Orc strength -1 for each ring-bound companion. Response: If a free people player reveals this card from your hand, discard this card to add 2 burdens.
The Lidless Eye looked out from Sauron's fortress.

card.name: Gate Soldier
card.property: When you play a [Sauron] condition, you may exert this minion and remove (2) to draw a card.
”…a host of orcs lurked, ready at a signal to issue forth like black ants going to war.”

card.name: Gate Trooper
card.property: When you play this minion, you may exert him and spot 5 burdens to draw a card.
“Another dreadful day of fear and toil had come to Mordor; and the night-guards were summoned….”

card.name: Gate Veteran
card.property: When you play this minion, you may exert him and spot 6 companions to draw a card.
”…the day-guards, evil-eyed and fell, were marching to their posts.”

card.name: Grishnakh
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -3. Shadow: Exert Grishnakh twice and spot another [Sauron] Orc to draw 3 cards. The Free Peoples player may add 2 burdens to prevent this.

card.name: Grishnakh
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -3. Shadow: Exert Grishnakh twice and spot another [Sauron] Orc to draw 3 cards. The Free Peoples player may add 2 burdens to prevent this.

card.name: I
card.property: To play, exert 2 [Sauron] Orcs. Plays to your support area. The Shadow number of each site is +1 for each wound on a Hobbit (limit +3).
”'If I had my way, you'd wish you were dead now.'”

card.name: Morannon
card.property: Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of the first [Sauron] Orc played at site 4T is -3. Shadow: Spot 2 [Sauron] Orcs and discard 4 cards from hand to draw 3 cards. Discard this condition.
The black gate of Mordor was called the Morannon.

card.name: Orc Captain
card.property: When you play this minion, you may spot a [Sauron] condition to draw a card for each site you control (limit 3).
”…far away from hidden holds and outposts in the hills came answering calls….”

card.name: Orc Cutthroat
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -3. Skirmish: Discard another [Sauron] Orc and exert Orc Cutthroat to wound a companion he is skirmishing.
A few Orc casualties were of no concern to him.

card.name: Orc Fighter
card.property: Regroup: Spot a [Sauron] condition and exert this minion to take control of a site.
The Orcs of Mordor extended the will of Sauron to control the weak Men of the East.

card.name: Orc Infantry
card.property: Regroup: Spot a [Sauron] condition and discard this minion to take control of a site.

card.name: Orc Patrol
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -3. Maneuver: Exert Orc Patrol twice and spot another [Sauron] Orc to discard a condition.
Sauron's Orcs ranged far and wide, searching for Baggins and the Ring.

card.name: Orc Pursuer
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -1. When you play this minion, you may exert him and remove (2) to draw a card.
”'…why not kill them now? They're a cursed nuisance, and we're in a hurry.'”

card.name: Orc Runner
card.property: Tracker. The site number of each [Sauron] Orc is -1. When you play this minion you may exert him and discard 2 cards from hand to draw a card.
”'There's no time to kill them properly…. No time for play on this trip.'”

card.name: Teeth of Mordor
card.property: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Spot a [Sauron] Orc and remove (3) to stack that minion here. Shadow: Play a [Sauron] Orc stacked here as if played from hand.
“None could pass the Teeth of Mordor and not feel their bite….”

card.name: Frodo
card.property: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). Fellowship: Add a burden to play Smeagol from your discard pile.
”'We promises, yes I promise!…”

card.name: No Help for It
card.property: Regroup: Spot Sam and discard Smeagol or Gollum to remove 3 burdens.
”'…he'll come back, you'll see. The promise will hold yet a while. And he won't leave his Precious, anyway.'”

card.name: No Use That Way
card.property: Skirmish: Add 3 burdens to wound a minion skirmishing a companion who has the Frodo signet twice.
”'Don't take the Precious to Him!…”

card.name: Rare Good Ballast
card.property: Plays on Sam. Response: If a regroup special ability is used, discard Smeagol or Gollum to cancel that action.
”'What a hobbit needs with coney… is some herbs and roots, especially taters - not to mention bread.'”

card.name: Sam
card.property: Ring-bound. While you can spot Frodo and Smeagol, Sam may not be overwhelmed unless is strength is tripled. Response: If Frodo is killed, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).
”'Trust”

card.name: Sting
card.property: Bearer must be Frodo. Skirmish: Exert Frodo to make Smeagol strength +2 or Gollum strength -2.
”'This is Sting. You have seen it before once upon a time.'”

card.name: Sting
card.property: Bearer must be Frodo. Skirmish: Exert Frodo to make Smeagol strength +2 or Gollum strength -2.
”'This is Sting. You have seen it before once upon a time.'”

card.name: You Must Help Us
card.property: Fellowship: Play Smeagol from your discard pile to heal each Ring-bound Hobbit twice.
”'You will have to come with us, that's all, while we keep an eye on you.'”

card.name: Hornburg Wall
card.property: Regroup: Spot your minion and remove (9) to make the fellowship move again this turn (if the move limit allows).

card.name: Nan Curunir
card.property: Plains. Response: If your mounted minion is about to take a wound, remove (2) to prevent that wound.

card.name: Caverns of Isengard
card.property: Underground. The Free Peoples player wins the game only if the Ring-bearer survives until Shadow players reconcile.

card.name: Legolas
card.property: Archer. Each time Legolas wins a skirmish, you may heal a Dwarf companion or another Elf companion.
”'…even more would I give for a hundred good archers of Mirkwood. We shall need them.'”

card.name: Eowyn
card.property: Valiant. Maneuver: Play a [Rohan] possession on Eowyn to heal her.

card.name: Baruk Khazad
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound a minion. You may take the next maneuver action.
“Axes of the Dwarves!” cried Gimli in the secret tongue of his kin.

card.name: Break the Charge
card.property: Archery: Exert 3 Elf companions to make the fellowship archery total +2.
A wall of Elven arrows met the attackers before they reached the Hornburg itself.

card.name: Foul Horde
card.property: Warg-rider. While Foul Horde is not exhausted, it is fierce. While Foul Horde has at least 3 vitality, it is ambush (1). While Foul Horde has at least 4 vitality, it is damage + 1.

card.name: Army of Haradrim
card.property: Southron. Skirmish: Remove (3) to play a [Raider] mount from your discard pile.
Lacking shields and armor, Southron forces rely on speed and numbers.

card.name: Rohirrim Helm
card.property: Bearer must be [Rohan] Man. Skirmish: Discard this possession to cancel a skirmish involving bearer. A minion in this skirmish may exert to prevent this.
A helm split by an Uruk blade often still saves the rider who wears it.

card.name: Thundering Host
card.property: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a mounted [Rohan] Man strength +3 (and heal that man if at a plains).
The roar of hooves was enough to rout the Uruk-hai without sword or spear.

card.name: Gollum
card.property: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each times Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.

card.name: Grima
card.property: Maneuver: Spot 4 Free Peoples cultures and exert Grima to return an unbound companion, and all cards on him or her, to their owners' hands.
